intro: Tithymalus chankoanus, commonly known as the Chankoan tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, particularly in parts of Japan and Korea. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species in the botanical world.
